linkTarget.anchoringText: The existing methods of development of an oil deposit with a gas cap may be divided into two main groups schematically represented in Figure 1.

image-wrap.label: Figure 1
image-wrap.caption: Diagram of existing methods of development of oil deposit with gas cap

formatted-caption.caption-text: Diagram of existing methods of development of oil deposit with gas cap

linkTarget.anchoringText: General layout of multipurpose well design, as well as changing of the intended use of such well at different operation stages are shown in Figure 2 and in Table 1.

image-wrap.label: Figure 2
image-wrap.caption: General layout of multipurpose well design

formatted-caption.caption-text: General layout of multipurpose well design

linkTarget.anchoringText: Field A is located in the Yamalo-Nenets Autonomous District in the north of the Tyumen region and contains free oil, gas and condensate layer-uplifted deposits with an underlying water zone. Cross-section of Field A formations is presented in Figure 3.

image-wrap.label: Figure 4
image-wrap.caption: Placement of horizontal gas wells and multipurpose wells on net gas maps and net oil maps of zone A2

formatted-caption.caption-text: Placement of horizontal gas wells and multipurpose wells on net gas maps and net oil maps of zone A2

linkTarget.anchoringText: After the first stage of separation (Psep 106 bar, Tsep - 30°C) high pressure gas will be headed to the GTP under its own pressure for joint treatment with reservoir gas. Separated oil, condensate and water are headed to the second separation stage (Psep 20 bar, Tsep - 25°C) after which they are supplied to the OTP for further oil treatment and release into the export transport system. Flow diagram of the collection and transport system of wellstream of gas and multipurpose wells of field is shown in Figure 5.

image-wrap.label: Figure 5
image-wrap.caption: Flow diagram of the collection and transport system of wellstream of gas and multipurpose wells field A

formatted-caption.caption-text: Flow diagram of the collection and transport system of wellstream of gas and multipurpose wells field A

linkTarget.anchoringText: If we set the task of gas production maximizing, then, on the one hand, we lose some cumulative oil production with decrease of ORF from 11.3 to 10.5%, and on the other hand, this strategy will allow to shift start-up of the booster compressor station for more than half a year and to increase cumulative gas production by 2 bln. m3. Comparison of calculation results of the "Oil Production Maximizing" and the "Gas Production Maximizing" options in the integrated model is shown in Figures 6 and 7.

image-wrap.label: Figure 6
image-wrap.caption: Comparison of gas production at the GTP for the "Oil Production Maximizing" and the "Gas Production Maximizing" options

formatted-caption.caption-text: Comparison of gas production at the GTP for the "Oil Production Maximizing" and the "Gas Production Maximizing" options

linkTarget.anchoringText: If we set the task of gas production maximizing, then, on the one hand, we lose some cumulative oil production with decrease of ORF from 11.3 to 10.5%, and on the other hand, this strategy will allow to shift start-up of the booster compressor station for more than half a year and to increase cumulative gas production by 2 bln. m3. Comparison of calculation results of the "Oil Production Maximizing" and the "Gas Production Maximizing" options in the integrated model is shown in Figures 6 and 7.

image-wrap.label: Figure 7
image-wrap.caption: Comparison of oil and liquid production at the OTP for the "Oil Production Maximizing" and the "Gas Production Maximizing" options

formatted-caption.caption-text: Comparison of oil and liquid production at the OTP for the "Oil Production Maximizing" and the "Gas Production Maximizing" options

linkTarget.anchoringText: The dotted line in graphs in Figures 8 and 9 shows the option with controlled gas recovery from the gas cap using the assembly with electrical valve for control of gas inflow from the gas cap; solid line shows the option with uncontrolled gas recovery from the gas cap.

image-wrap.label: Figure 8
image-wrap.caption: Correlation of gas production profiles at the GTP for different options with controlled and uncontrolled gas recovery from gas cap

formatted-caption.caption-text: Correlation of gas production profiles at the GTP for different options with controlled and uncontrolled gas recovery from gas cap

linkTarget.anchoringText: The dotted line in graphs in Figures 8 and 9 shows the option with controlled gas recovery from the gas cap using the assembly with electrical valve for control of gas inflow from the gas cap; solid line shows the option with uncontrolled gas recovery from the gas cap.

image-wrap.label: Figure 9
image-wrap.caption: Correlation of liquid and oil production profiles at the OTP for different options with controlled and uncontrolled gas recovery from gas cap

formatted-caption.caption-text: Correlation of liquid and oil production profiles at the OTP for different options with controlled and uncontrolled gas recovery from gas cap
